title: Commission Regulation (EC) No 1638/94 of 5 July 1994 concerning the classification of certain goods in the combined nomenclature
header:
7.7.1994 EN Official Journal of the European Communities L 172/5
COMMISSION REGULATION (EC) No 1638/94
of 5 July 1994
concerning the classification of certain goods in the combined nomenclature
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: The goods described in column 1 of the annexed table are now classified within the combined nomenclature under the appropriate CN codes indicated in column 2 of the said table.

Binding tariff information issued by the customs authorities of Member States which do not conform to the rights established by this Regulation can continue to be invoked under the provisions of Article 12 (6) of Regulation (EEC) No 2913/92 for a period of three months.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the 21st day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 5 July 1994.
For the Commission
Christiane SCRIVENER
Member of the Commission
(1)  OJ No L 256, 7. 9. 1987, p. 1.
(2)  OJ No L 103, 22. 4. 1994, p. 5.
(3)  OJ No L 302, 19. 10. 1992, p. 1.
ANNEX
Description of goods Classification CN code Reasons
(1) (2) (3)
1. An adapter in its own housing, the main elements of which are: input/output boards, an interface board, a memory board, a control board (with active and passive components and monolithic integrated circuits) and a power supply board.
2. A link adapter in its own housing, consisting of two adapters, linked by cable and controlled by a microprocessor unit.
3. A transceiver in its own housing, the main elements of which are an input/output board, a control board (with active and passive components and monolithic integrated circuits) and an enclosed power supply.
4. An electronic assembly known as a Pinfet receiver consisting of the following components: PIN photo-detecting diode, microwave, FET amplifying transistors in chip form, bipolar semiconductor transistor chips, thick film printed resistors and chip capacitors.
5. Parts of mobile telephones:
(a) surface acoustic wave filter unit with a centre frequency of 45,5 MHz (± 50 kHz) and a bandwidth of 340 kHz at 3 dB (950 kHz at 20 dB) contained in a housing whose exterior dimensions do not exceed 5 x 13 x 21 mm, with not more than 6 connections.
(b) voltage-controlled oscillator with an oscillation frequency of 915 MHz or more at 4,5 V, and not exceeding 890 MHz at 1 V, contained in a housing whose exterior dimensions do not exceed 5 x 10 x 15 mm, with not more than 4 connections.
6. Endotracheal tubes principally used with anaesthetic apparatus.
7. An electronic component tester consisting of a cabinet containing a calculator, a test head including a contact panel, a printer, a keyboard and a monitor.
8. An electronic circuit board tester consisting of a cabinet containing a calculator, a test head including connectors or a contact panel, a printer, a keyboard and a monitor.
